review: OK, so I already have Roku, why do I need Chromecast? One reason is that my cable provider explicitly does not support HBO Go on Roku. But Chromecast is a go.I didn't realize that Chromecast does not use your phone's bandwidth for streaming; apparently Android hands off to Chromecast, and Chromecast then streams directly from the WiFi; keeps streaming even if you shut your phone off completely.  That's good; I wasn't expecting that.I don't like that nowhere in the product images do they show that this thing requires a wall charger. I knew it did, so was not disappointed, but some people might be unpleasantly surprised.  This doesn't matter too much since it's all hidden behind your TV.
author: Salvatore Mendola

author: LizzM

review: This device is definately not worth the money. It only works about half the time and doesn't do everything it claims. You can stream Netflix and Youtube from your Iphone/Ipad but only until the device gets confused. Since multiple devices can stream, it often forgets which device has control. Turn your Iphone off after streaming starts and there is no control over the device, which makes it very impractical to say the least.At times I can't get my devices to recognize Chromecast for more than a few seconds, then it drops again. I should point out that I am about 8 feet away from the TV and I can stream Netflix to my devices just fine. It also does the Netflix "sit and spin" far more often than when just streaming directly to my phone or tablet.Chrome browser does not have an extention for Chromecast on Iphone or Ipad, so forget using the device for web browsing. This was the primary reason for my choosing Chromecast over Roku.I suppose you can stream your Chrome Browser from a desktop or laptop, but my question is why???? It's easy enough to connect those devices to your TV without this stupid gadget. You can easily use and HDMI cable or even VGA which would work better than this.I wish I had bought Roku but wanted to save a few bucks. I will end up getting one anyway since this thing is so bad.
author: martin ward
